U. B. GOVERNMENT PRINTHOD OPFICH: 1039
This Certifies, that the person whose name and
description are given on this permit has registered with
the Aeronautics Branch, Department of Commerce, as
a Student Pilot, and is hereby authorized to receive
instruction on, and to pilot licensed aircraft in solo
practice flights, during this course of instruction.
Such solo flights shall be limited to the immediate
vicinity of the airport or landing field upon which the
instruction is based, and such flights shall not extend
beyond a safe gliding distance thereof.
At no time shall persons or property be carried in
a licensed aircraft piloted by the holder hereof, except
a bona fide instructor assigned by the person or com-
pany with whom the student is enrolled.
Your attention is called to Section 47 of the Air
Commerce
Regulations which prohibits any
but
licensed Transport Pilots from giving instruction in
licerised aircraft for hire.
NOTE.â€”All provisions of the Air Commerce Regu-
lations are made a part of the terms hereof as though
written herein.
This permit must be carried at all times while re-
ceiving instruction in or piloting licensed aircraft.
properties.sfomuseum:description: Student pilot permit from career of Pollack Flying Service and Pan American World Airways station manager and chief inspector Clyde J. Smith; issued by United States Department of Commerce, July 8, 1931.
